column4: If I boot failsafe GNOME, my computer is fine. As soon as I boot GNOME, the entire screen freezes. How can I fix this?
sounds like graphics trouble
I had the same problem with my other account, but it went away, and then I made this account
I had the same problem with my other account, but it went away, and then I made this account. (Ubuntu 10.04 LTS (32 bit))
are you sure it isn't an intermittent graphics issue?
how would I know if it was?
try varying the graphics load...do things that use 3d cause trouble? does turning Compiz on/off make a difference? what about video playback?
it usually freezes before its been up for a minute, no matter what I'm doing
well thats not true, if I dont load ANYTHING, it wont freeze
try Ctrl-Alt-F1 and logging in to a text console
what do you mean, when it freezes?
no, once you see the GDM login prompt
I dont get what you mean, like the login prompt where i enter my password and say if I want to boot GNOME or failsafe GNOME?
so is there anyway to fix this problem?
what graphics chip/card do you have?
what is the command to find that out?
lspci
This is what came out of the terminal:        http://pastebin.com/KKpg96Rf
then I'm not sure what's going on...maybe an overheating problem?
why would it not freeze in other account then?
mystery.
